review_text: Our favourite bar during our entire stay. We visited every day after our first visit was so great, and it became our local! The food was delicious and the service impeccable. Special shout out to Darren the legend. He made us feel so welcome every visit, especially with how busy this bar is and he remembered us and our drinks order and even the football team my parter supported so the bar felt very homely. Would 10/10 recommend. Get yourselves to Connolly‚Äôs guys. Will be back next year

This was an absolutely wonderful dining experience. The booth seating was awesome. A nice and quiet atmosphere. This is the best Fish & Chips I‚Äôve had in NYC. I‚Äôve tried several places but Connolly‚Äôs got it right. I did make a reservation but it‚Äôs not needed. I recommend Connolly‚Äôs highly and cannot wait to return.

After finding a pizza place that we wanted to go to closed we decided to check out Connolly's. Upon entering we were told to go upstairs for quicker service, so we did and we're immediately seated. A server grabbed us waters and I eventually ordered a downeast cider from MA. The cider was super refreshing and had hints of sweetness without being too overpowering.

With my stomach not being too happy I ordered a baked potato and my mom the fish and chips substituting the fries for onion rings. Well the onion rings, to put it as nice as possible, had seen better days. They were way over cooked and  hard as bricks--we did not need to even bite into one to notice this! Thankfully the server understood and swapped out the rings for another piece of fish.

And speaking of the fish it was amazing! Lightly fried and a little crispy around the edges it made every bite so good--no tartar sauce needed! Also, the meal came with coleslaw, which was nice surprise. It was cool and creamy and delicious as well. One of the servers recommended that next time we should get vinegar with the fish as it makes it even better.

Great service and good food.

Make sure you have a reservation! We did and were able to get seated faster ... but 30 minutes later than the reservation time. It was a Saturday night in early December and therefore busy. The crowds from Rockefeller Center Spilled Out for blocks in all directions. So getting to the restaurant was a challenge. The food was just okay. It came out very fast, the staff was very attentive and friendly. They're all doing the best they can. A very busy restaurant this Saturday night. They have to say it again, make sure you have a reservation! Pictures is Lance stew and fish and chips. Also other entrees are bangers and mash, potato leek soup, and then pump food.

Is Irish pub and restaurant is a fine choice for dinner before or after your show just off Broadway. We had the bangers and mash and the lamb burger both of which were delicious. Their Guinness is poured right from a tap and their establishment is clean and well-staffed.

Came here for a birthday dinner, overall the service and food could be slightly better for our party of 7.  We had the seafood fried rice on a hotplate, sea bass with mango salad, and 2 pad thai noodles, sausage and shrimp fried rice and the snow pea veggie dish and orange covered chicken.  IMO, for the price of the seafood fried rice on the sizzling hot plate is totally not worth it. Also had the dessert sampler which looked amazing.  Pretty much we are there just for the atmosphere of the restaurant.  It isn‚Äôt anything authentic if that is your thing.  For 7 people outta the door plus tips is about $380.. which is somewhat reasonable.

Worth all of the hype‚Äî dishes, ambiance and service are all truly fantastic. Making a reservation is an absolute must. My date booked online for a late Saturday night and we were pretty much seated on time. The filet mignon with black garlic, shiitake butter and sun chokes was divine. The spicy tuna on crispy rice was extravagant. Many other tables enjoyed that as a shared plate as well. My date loved the traditional orange chicken and we shared an order of vegetable fried rice. Highly recommend for an evening of contemporary flair and upscale dining.

TAO is a must visit experience in New York. The restaurant is stunning, with an impressive atmosphere that blends elegance and energy, making it perfect for a special dinner or a night out. We went as a group of three and tried several different dishes, all of them excellent full of flavor, beautifully presented, and perfect for sharing. The menu offers a great variety of highquality Asian inspired options, from sushi to hot dishes. The service was attentive and professional, and the vibrant ambiance makes the whole experience even more memorable. Definitely an iconic restaurant worth visiting.

Old but still contemporary.

Such a value. Lunch special!
We had vegetable rolls, shrimp, wraps for appetizers and kungpao chicken, noodle, steak for main. Couldn't eat them all.
Grand interior never gets old.
Serving very cordial as well.
Next time, may come alone and eat at the bar.

Went to Tao uptown last night to celebrate a belated birthday and service, food and atmosphere were all 10 out of 10. Our server Paolo was the absolute best! Will absolutely ask for him next time we make a reservation. He made our dining experience even more fun, plus he took care of some of my friend‚Äôs dietary restrictions with ease. Drinks, apps, mains, and desserts all incredible. The orange chicken, fried rice, rock shrimp, and fortune cookie dessert were some of the favs.

Review ‚Äì Carmine‚Äôs (Times Square, NYC)

Carmine‚Äôs is a classic Italian restaurant right in the heart of Times Square, and it‚Äôs absolutely a must-go if you‚Äôre in the area. The place has that old-school Italian charm ‚Äîbustling, lively, and full of energy‚Äî perfect for groups or family-style dining.

The portions are enormous. Seriously, one dish can easily serve three to five people. We were two and ordered a lasagna, which could have fed four hungry diners without a problem. The flavors were rich and comforting, exactly what you‚Äôd expect from a great Italian spot.

The service is outstanding ‚Äîfriendly, efficient, and perfectly coordinated, even though the restaurant is huge and always busy. I‚Äôd recommend making a reservation, but even if you don‚Äôt, the staff handles everything very smoothly.

Prices are extremely reasonable, especially considering the portion sizes and location. We were so full we couldn‚Äôt even think about dessert ‚Äîa rare thing!

üìç Conclusion:
Carmine‚Äôs is an NYC institution that delivers big flavor, big portions, and great service. Ideal for sharing and enjoying a true Italian-American dining experience.

‚≠ê Overall rating: 9.5/10
üçù Best: massive portions and excellent service.
üç∞ Worst: impossible to save room for dessert.
üí∏ Price: amazing value for Times Square.

Carmine's in NYC is an absolute must for a birthday dinner! The atmosphere is buzzing and so much fun, perfect for celebrating. And the food? Huge portions of classic Italian comfort food that everyone will love. You definitely won't leave hungry, and it makes for a really memorable birthday experience.

Great food.  Huge portions.   Best if you are in a large group since each entree feed 3 people.  We loved the calamari and chicken parmigiana.  Very generous bread baskets.  The titanic ice cream dessert was delicious.  It‚Äôs a little loud so you have to speak loudly for conversation.

Carmine‚Äôs Italian Restaurant was absolutely amazing! From start to finish, the experience was worth every minute. Our waitress, Kiara, was phenomenal. She was so kind, attentive, and genuinely made us feel taken care of the entire time. The food came out perfectly cooked and full of flavor, with very generous family-style portions. Seriously‚Ä¶huge servings. They even packed our to-go boxes neatly and thoughtfully which was such a nice touch. We didn‚Äôt have a reservation and waited about 45 minutes, but it was beyond worth it. The atmosphere, service and food all delivered. We‚Äôd gladly wait again. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in NYC and want a memorable, comforting Italian meal.

it's a big restaurant. They have wheelchair accessible entrance and seating, they have a elevator, they have a coat check in for coats & strollers. This restaurant is family-friendly you can come alone or for a date or even with your kids. The wait is crazy this restaurant is very busy and packed, even with a reservation you have to wait for a table. you have to do a reservation they never have tables available it be so packed. The waiters are nice and friendly they so be so busy but they make sure they pay attention to you and they make sure you good everytime. The drinks was wack taste like juice, the food was amazing it taste very good the steak is expensive but is worth it has great taste one of the best steaks I ever tasted with great flavor and seasoning. The dishes are huge so you can share with 3 people or even 4. I came for my nephew's birthday he loved it we got him the sundae which was amazing the whole table got some. This restaurant is a great Italian restaurant i would come back. the drinks need to be better.

This was my first time dining at Bryant Park Grill, and it was absolutely amazing! From start to finish, the experience exceeded expectations.

Our server Lena was a darling:  attentive, warm, and made sure everything was perfect. We started with the jumbo lump crab cake and salad, which was fresh and flavorful. My friend had the cashew-crusted salmon (he swapped the potatoes for asparagus,  great choice!), and I had the pan-roasted branzino, cooked to perfection. The blackberry nojito seltzer was a hit! We ended the evening with a chocolate brownie and vanilla ice cream that was the perfect sweet touch.

Despite the buzz of the city around us, the atmosphere felt calm and intimate.   A little oasis right in the heart of it all. I guess when you have an amazing date and great food, nothing else really matters üòä

Highly recommend and can‚Äôt wait to return!

We were very let down. Marked that we were celebrating a special occasion which was acknowledged by no one. Both hosts/managers hosting felt irritated and offered zero warmth or connection upon entering and being seated. Soon as we hit the table multiple parties near us were asking where there servers were, even getting up and going to the host stand to ask why a waiter hasn't come for their order. We experienced the same delay and decided to just order drinks given the obvious concerns from other patrons about the lack of attentiveness and concern for their business or their family's meals. Our waiter while doing his job, was just like the host stand, no real connection, no small talk, no how are you, thanks for coming. Just to the point and not attached to the vibes of his customers or engaging in any meaningful way. This is the last thing I expect from an icon that makes their money from hosting special occasions and charges what they do for dishes and cocktails. I'll pay the price for quality all day, but the service was truly horrible on Sat January 3rd when we visited around 7:00pm to the point we felt ripped off. The atmosphere was classy, warm, inviting... But the people running the business that evening couldn't match that expectation, and their impact brought the entire evening down. Dozens of experiences in NYC where restaurants are hyped up and deliver, not here. BP Grill should reevaluate who staffs a critical holiday weekends and I hope others don't walk away feeling so disappointed like we did.

Got seated within a couple of minutes despite all the dinner peak hour rush in a holiday season. Customer service was excellent - took care of orders and food delivery in a timely manner. Food was amazing - well cooked and perfect taste. Drink options were good. Not too noisy for conversations. Place appeared clean and well maintained.

For opening day of the Winter Village I was at Bryant Park. Although I walked to see the decor of another restaurant not liking the way I was treated,went back to Bryant Park Grill,which was not crowded at all. I was seated with courtesy and a smile. The lunch was excellent as was my cucumber refresher movktail. The Foccia bread was sublime. Served on a light layer of olive oil,with fresh butter topped with a sprig of rosemary. I was so happy to have walked back to the park for this.
Excellent,excellent service,servers and food

Came here with a party of 9 after our original reservation somewhere else fell through and got seated right away! And this was during xmas week! They have a big outdoor (tented/heated) and cute seating area so there is a lot of seating, even during peak hours. I ordered the branzino and it was absolutely delicious! Someone else in my party ordered the salmon and loved it as well. Even though the menu items are on the pricier side, I would say it‚Äôs worth it since the food is great and this restaurant is in such a prime location!

For a few years in the late 1970s, I worked literally three blocks from Grand Central Station. And I‚Äôve spent many more years since then working in and visiting New York City. Yet somehow‚Äîalmost inexplicably‚ÄîI had never set foot in the Grand Central Oyster Bar.

Thankfully, that oversight was corrected in mid-December, when I found myself in the neighborhood looking for lunch and finally answered the call of this legendary spot.

Walking down into the Oyster Bar feels like stepping into another era of New York: the iconic tiled, vaulted ceilings, the gentle hum of conversation, and the sense that very little here has changed‚Äîand that‚Äôs exactly the point.

I took a seat at the long counter, which turned out to be the perfect vantage point. From there, I could watch the shuckers work with practiced ease and see a cook steadily turning out stews, "roasts", and chowders, all with the quiet efficiency that comes from doing something well for over a century.

There‚Äôs a reassuring confidence to the place, the kind that only comes from decades of consistency.

Lunch itself was excellent. I started with six Long Island Cherrystone clams and a half-dozen Malpeque oysters from Prince Edward Island‚Äîfresh, briny, and impeccably handled.

To finish, I ordered a bowl of red Manhattan clam chowder, my longtime favorite style, and one that many consider among the best anywhere. It was deeply flavorful, balanced, and exactly what I hoped it would be.

The Grand Central Oyster Bar isn‚Äôt about trends or reinvention. It‚Äôs about tradition, quality seafood, and a singular sense of place‚Äîsomething increasingly rare. I‚Äôm genuinely glad I finally made it, and I won‚Äôt be waiting decades before my next visit. Highly recommended that you stop in sometime yourself.

Such a simple guilty pleasure... raw oysters, a pan roast and a berr for lunch. Oysters are always fresh and many to chose from. I like to get 2 each of 6 different ones. The server's favorite turned put to be mine as well. Clam pan roast is so good, filling and soaked up into the oyster crackers nicely. I sit at the counter close to the oyster shockers and the stew/pan roast prep. It's all fun to watch.

Really cool restaurant in Grand Central Station.  Visiting NY and wanted done oysters and seafood.  Oysters weren't bad, but the greatest.  We had a wide selection hoping for some Britney plump Oysters, but they were average at best.  Clam chowder wasn't bad.  Have had seafood at plenty of restaurants along the coast. This place was average and more a novelty with being in Grand Central Station.  We sat on restaurant seated site, then have a more laid back open dining area, and then a bar lounge area. Liked the setup, wish food was much better, really wanted to love it. But liked it at best.

I have very wife spectrum of experience at this place. Sometimes really fantastic. Good vibe at Saloon bar. Martinis and oysters... sometimes not so... especially pickpocket roaming around and management not responsive.

This time at oyster bar side. Fantastic one. Oysters were good. Clams and chowder too. Martinis crisp with extra on the side. Service attentive.

Architectural marvel. Historic vibe wonderful. Let's keep up the consistency!

The service was excellent. Brendan was quick, friendly, and professional.
The sea bass was very good. The scallops and pork belly had as a a side what I am told is the best corn my dining companion has had in his life. The scallops were not flavorful but the pork belly was recommended.
Great oysters.
I recommend the tiger shrimp dumplings.
The lobster bisque had chunks of lobster, and was well flavored.

Gluten Free/Celiac was a breeze here. Gabby, our server, was absolutely lovely and took great care of us. She assured me that my food was safe and she even double checked. Food was amazing. Atmosphere was so relaxing and enjoyable.
If you are in Times Square‚Ä¶‚Ä¶you gotta eat here!

My husband and I love going here for date night. The happy hour menu is incredible and slept on. The buffalo cauliflower is a must and their sushi is incredible! You must try their blueberry margarita!!

Absolutely delicious. The decor and the atmosphere was so stunning, the hostess, servers everyone was absolutely wonderful. Came here on a Sunday around 5pm after seeing a play at the Marquis theater not crowded? Food came out quickly? Prices were more than fair. True hidden GEM! Definitely stop by if you‚Äôre in this area seeing one of the Broadway plays.

Came here on a Thursday evening. The atmosphere was calming and nice. The Miso glazed Sea Bass & Pan seared Salmon was fresh & delicious. Our server, Al, was great to work with & helpful in choosing our entrees. Look forward to visiting again!

Had an amazing experience at Shake Shack! The male server who delivered our burgers was incredibly energetic and full of smiles. He served our food swiftly and diligently, explaining everything clearly, all while keeping a positive, lively vibe throughout the restaurant.

He really set the tone for the whole place, making it feel welcoming and well managed, and the cleanliness of the tables and surroundings was noticeable too. Truly a standout example of excellent service, definitely deserves praise!

üçî Quick, tasty, and full of little surprises!

We stopped by Shake Shack in the Theater District for a casual dinner ‚Äî and it turned out to be a really great choice. The service was fast, and what‚Äôs nice is that they actually bring the food right to your table, which makes the experience more relaxed and enjoyable. üôå

I ordered one of their classic burgers and was surprised by a fun little twist ‚Äî crispy fried pickles in batter! ü•í‚ú® It was something different and added a nice crunch to the meal. Everything was hot, fresh, and full of flavor.

There‚Äôs plenty of seating, which is a big plus in this area, and it didn‚Äôt feel cramped or noisy even during the dinner rush. Tables were clean, and the vibe was welcoming.

‚úÖ Great for a quick bite before or after a Broadway show
‚úÖ Fun menu twists (fried pickles, yes please!)
‚úÖ Enough space to sit down and enjoy your meal

If you‚Äôre in Midtown and need a fast, delicious, and hassle-free dinner ‚Äî I definitely recommend this location of Shake Shack! üçüüçî

Delicious burgers and milkshakes. Friendly service. Reasonable prices. Gets very crowded and hard to find a table to sit at.  Does have some counters to stand up and eat also. Has a restroom for customers. Free cups of water.

Love their burgers! I always get them well done. They are nice and juicy and the best with lettuce tomato and onions. My baby had  a mix of ice cream chocolate and vanilla with Oreo topping and he loved it. The staff was very accommodating attentive and friendly.

Stopped by Shake Shack Theatre Street, NYC for a late-night bite, and even at 10 PM, the place was packed‚Äîa testament to its popularity, but also a reminder that you might need to wait for a table. Ambience was nothing special, just your typical fast-casual setup, but the food made up for it.
Tried the Truffle Burger, and it delivered-tender, juicy patties with deep, rich flavors that didn't disappoint. The milkshake? A standout! Fragrant, creamy, and indulgent without feeling too heavy. Bonus points for table delivery, which made the experience smoother.

If you don't mind the crowd, it's a solid spot for a satisfying, late-night burger fix. Would I return? Yes, if I am looking for a quick meal.

This modern spot feels like an urban oasis, blending seamlessly into a spacious park setting. There are plenty of open-air tables, giving the place a relaxed and airy vibe. At night, string lights glow in the trees, creating a magical and surprisingly romantic atmosphere right in the middle of New York‚Äôs hustle and bustle.

Shake Shack has locations all over the world, but enjoying it at the original location‚Äîsurrounded by skyscrapers and fresh park air‚Äîfeels truly special. It‚Äôs the perfect blend of where it all began and where it‚Äôs at its best. A must-visit when you‚Äôre in New York.

Ah, the birthplace of the ShackBurger. A shrine to hype. A temple of queues. And yet, somehow, a graveyard for flavor.

Let‚Äôs start with the kitchen: twelve people in branded t-shirts, bustling like extras in a food-themed sitcom. Only two appeared to be working. The rest? Pacing, chatting, possibly auditioning for a reboot of Waiting for Godot. Meanwhile, your burger dreams die slowly in the fryer fumes.

The food? A soggy, lukewarm betrayal. Fries that taste like they were prepped during the Bush administration. Buns with the texture of damp cardboard. Cheese that whispers ‚ÄúI used to be milk but now I‚Äôm just plastic‚Äù before vanishing into the ether.

And the seating, oh, the seating. A gladiatorial contest of elbows and passive-aggressive hovering. If you do snag a spot, you‚Äôre rewarded with the only redeeming feature: summer people-watching. Tourists marveling at squirrels, locals pretending this is still cool, and pigeons plotting unionization.

Come winter, the charm freezes over. You‚Äôre left with overpriced sadness and the haunting suspicion that Danny Meyer weeps softly into a crinkle-cut fry every time someone calls this ‚Äúiconic.‚Äù

Save your money. Save your dignity. Go to literally any bodega and get a sandwich made by someone who cares.

It was a long lineup , which made me to think it should be a good place to try the food. I almost waited for 15-20 mins for order and get the Veggie burger. I loved the vibe which is a nice park and has bench to seat. I would say it was ok, but worth to stop and try because of the vibe.

The hot dogs were very good.  The service fast and friendly. The vibe in the park was perfect with a busking Jazz trio adding to the atmosphere. My only wish that smokers (all weeds) were not allowed near tables where people are eating.

Beautiful place to stop for a bite to eat and see the flagship Shake Shack, the original! Fun to see where it all started. It's not cheap (This meal cost $66.99) and the wait is long when it's busy but it's delicious!!

A unique dining experience must try. We came here for our daughter‚Äôs birthday. You have to wait in line as no reservations so be prepared to stand in line, we waited about 1.5 hrs to get table.  You walk into servers serving food and singing songs from broadway plays as well as other songs. It is a lively fun experience while you enjoy your meal. The food was good with vegetarian options. We especially loved the nachos. The drinks were good as well nothing exceptional but still good. Our daughter enjoyed hearing all the Broadway songs and the servers did a fanatic job.

Great experience. I recommend visiting around midday as that‚Äôs their quieter times and we didn‚Äôt queue at all.

The singing is fantastic and obviously what you go there for however the food was OK, not much flavour.

I saw reviews about the tip box being constant but we only had it once and you wasn‚Äôt pressured.

For 2x burgers, fries and 2 soft drinks was $86 including a 20% tip that was automatically added to the bill so it was clear on our visit by the staff you didn‚Äôt have to cash tip.

MLK Weekend 2026: My daughter & I visited for our 1st NYC trip & her 18th Birthday! What a fabulous experience! Great entertainment, service, & food! The line to wait was LONG, but the time it took to get seated was relatively QUICK! Probably 30 people deep in line, sat within 15 minutes! Hope to go back & take friends & family!

We‚Äôve been to Ellen‚Äôs Stardust Diner twice ‚Äî the most recent visit was in the summer when we brought friends. Just like always, no matter what time you arrive, there‚Äôs a long line outside. It has become part of the experience at this point.

The biggest highlight of this diner is definitely the singing waitstaff. They don‚Äôt just serve your food and take your order ‚Äî they perform amazing Broadway-style songs right in front of you. It‚Äôs such a fun and unique atmosphere! Many of them are hoping to make it onto Broadway someday, so this place feels like a stepping stone for real talent.

Now‚Ä¶ the food. Let‚Äôs just say you‚Äôre not here for a Michelin-star meal. It‚Äôs very average diner food, maybe even a bit below that. Nothing terrible, but definitely not why you come here. You‚Äôre paying for the show, the energy, the nostalgia, and the one-of-a-kind entertainment.

So if you‚Äôre visiting New York with friends or family and want something memorable (and loud), this is the place. Come for the singing ‚Äî not the menu.

What a fun place to have a meal! The long line to get inside is definitely justified -- and don't be daunted because the waiting isn't as long as it may look. Inside you enter a buzz of activity and entertainment. Non-stop singing by a talented wait staff makes for a memorable meal. And the food is pretty darn good. We enjoyed burgers and sandwiches for lunch and the portions were large and tasty  Overall, an incredibly fun experience and a can't miss if you are visiting NYC.

We frequent here for all major celebrations because the steak is unbeatable and the atmosphere is nice.

Highly recommend:
Porterhouse
Ribeye
Tuna tartare
Mashed potatoes
Fried Calamari (off menu app)

Shoutout to Sanem the best waitress we have had while at Del Frisco. I‚Äôm mainly writing this review to mention her exemplary service.

We had just made it to town, were hungry, and didn't want to shop around for food. My wife and I dined here the last time we were in town and loved our meal. So, dining hear again was a no brainer.. Del Frisco's it is.

Our second time didn't disappoint either We ordered steaks, cocktails, appetizers and wine.

For the cocktails, she had the Passion Fruit Margarita, and I had the Whistle Pig Barrel Aged Manhattan. The cocktails were on point. Additionally, we both had a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon with our meal.

For the appetizer we went with the Thick-Cut Nueske‚Äôs Bacon and the Charred Octopus. The Bacon was excellent, smokey and delicious. The Octopus was disappointing.  It was overcooked and chewy, so we had to send that one back.

For our main courses, my wife ordered the Braised Angus Short Rib and was  later informed  that it was sold out, so she settled for the Filet Mignon, and I had the Bone-In Prime Ribeye.  For our sides we had fries, broccolini and the Classic Caesar. Oh, and not to mention, that wonderful warm bread for the table. All of the meats were cooked to perfection, the sides were great, but on a side note... the side of fries was way more then we expected. I would say was enough for 5 people.

The steak house itself has a nice sexy ambiance, but still chill enough for the fellas to grab a meal or hang at the bar.

The service was great, our waiter M.D. was very professional and attentive. He was very apologetic for the mess up on the Short Rib order and the over cooked Octopus. Even the Supervisor,  (Kristin), came over and checked on us to make sure we were good and chatted with us about the New York food scene.

Thank you both for a good time.

This is genuinely one of my favorite steakhouses in the world. Its one of those rare place where no matter what you choose on the menu you do so with confidence that it will be delicious. It is pricey of course but the flavor more than delivers, the quality is top notch and the portion sizes are truly *american*. It is also very lively inside (for dinner) but quiet enough to have conversations. The tall ceilings and large windows create a spacious atmosphere.

Five-Star Review for Del Frisco‚Äôs ‚Äì Manhattan

Del Frisco‚Äôs in Manhattan delivers an experience that reminds you why New York City is known for world-class dining. From the moment you step inside, the atmosphere feels elevated and full of energy. The staff greets you warmly and treats you like a valued guest throughout the entire meal. The service is smooth, attentive, and thoughtful without ever feeling rushed. Everyone working there seems to take real pride in what they do, which sets the tone for the rest of the evening.

The steaks truly deserve the reputation they have. Each cut is cooked exactly the way you ask, with a perfect sear on the outside and a tender, flavorful center. You can tell the kitchen uses high-quality ingredients and takes care in every step. The sides are just as impressive. The lobster macaroni and cheese, creamed spinach, and mashed potatoes are rich and satisfying. They complement the main dishes rather than overpowering them. Even the bread service is memorable, which says a lot about the overall attention to detail.

The seafood options are another highlight. The crab cakes are packed with lump crab meat and seasoned well. The shrimp cocktail is fresh and chilled correctly. Everything arrives beautifully presented, and the flavors match the presentation. For drinks, the wine list is extensive and curated with care. The staff is knowledgeable and ready to help you pair the right bottle or cocktail with your meal.

Dessert is worth saving room for. The butter cake is one of the best ways to end a dinner, warm and soft with a balance of sweetness that makes you want to order another. Whether you are celebrating a special occasion or just want a great night out, Del Frisco‚Äôs knows how to make the evening feel important.

Overall, Del Frisco‚Äôs in Manhattan stands out because it combines outstanding food, excellent service, and a welcoming atmosphere. Every part of the dining experience feels intentional. It is easy to see why so many people consider it a must-visit steakhouse in the city. If you want a meal that is consistently exceptional from start to finish, this is the place to go. This is a well-deserved five-star experience.

This is my goto place when I have family and friends visiting from overseas. They haven‚Äôt disappointed me so far! The steak ‚Äî cooked perfectly to your liking üòãThe lobster Mac and cheese has good chunks of Lobster, creamy sauce and aldente pasta. We also had the octopus appetizer and it‚Äôs soooo good. Flavorful, right chewiness and good portion size. The other thing I look forward to is their honey bread and  the best part ‚Äî it‚Äôs complementary. üòâ

This restaurant delivers an outstanding dining experience! The atmosphere is elegant yet comfortable, with a great mix of modern design and warmth. The menu offers a variety of premium steaks, seafood, and creative appetizers ‚Äî everything beautifully presented and delicious. The quality and flavor are exceptional. Special thanks to Kai, the manager, who is absolutely fantastic ‚Äî attentive, professional, and genuinely cares about every guest‚Äôs experience. Highly recommended!

Dining at Morton‚Äôs The Steakhouse on Fifth Avenue was a real pleasure from start to finish. The atmosphere is elegant yet relaxed, with the perfect blend of classic New York steakhouse charm and professional service.

The porterhouse steak was cooked to perfection ‚Äî juicy, flavorful, and beautifully seared. The French fries were crisp and seasoned just right, while the signature onion bread was warm and irresistible.

For starters, I tried the meatball with burrata and pesto, a surprising and delicious choice that felt both Italian and American in style. Everything was paired with a great selection of wines and cocktails; my dirty martini was perfectly balanced.

Overall, Morton‚Äôs remains a benchmark for high-quality dining in New York City ‚Äî excellent food, attentive staff, and a timeless atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a true steakhouse experience.

It has become a little tradition for me ‚Äî every time I‚Äôm in the USA, I have to visit Morton‚Äôs for their amazing shrimp! The food never disappoints ‚Äî perfectly cooked, flavorful, and always fresh. The steak and sides were also excellent, but the shrimp is always my personal favorite.

The service is top-notch, as always. The staff were attentive, friendly, and made me feel genuinely welcomed. The atmosphere is classic and elegant, yet still relaxed ‚Äî perfect for both a nice dinner or a special occasion.

The Food: While the standard tasting menu is excellent, the culinary technicality is world-class. The flavors and presentation perfectly reflect the level of precision expected of Chef Keller. An unforgettable dining experience at Per Se, and one that truly lives up to every one of its three Michelin stars.

From the moment you step into the main dining room, you‚Äôre immersed in elegance, a beautiful, serene setting overlooking the park, elevated further by the warm glow of the fireplace that creates an inviting and refined ambiance.

The tasting menu offered both vegetarian and meat/fish options. I chose the vegetarian menu, and it was hands down the most delicious tasting menu I‚Äôve had in a long time. Every dish was thoughtful, balanced, and impeccably executed. The mushroom pie was absolutely out of this world- a luxurious blend of exotic mushrooms, seared to perfection, rich yet incredibly refined. Per Se is truly worthy of each and every star. A flawless culinary journey from start to finish, and an experience I will remember for a long time to come.

Background
Per Se is synonymous with a rigorously precise, French inspired tasting menu experience. Even its shorter menus are designed to reflect the full philosophy of the kitchen rather than serve as a compromise.

Ambience
The dining room is dimly lit and serene. While we were not seated in the main dining hall, our table faced the New York skyline, which added a cinematic calm to the evening. The space felt formal yet not stiff, elegant without intimidation.

Service
Service was impeccable and precise. Staff were attentive without hovering and thoughtful without excess. The presence of a vegetarian menu executed with equal seriousness deserves special praise.

Food and drink
The four course menu was skilfully crafted and coherent from start to finish. Each plate showed restraint and clarity. The true revelation was the dessert course. It was a masterpiece of balance and whimsy, arguably the most compelling and memorable sequence of the meal. It is one of the best if not the best dessert. Kudos

Overall
Per Se proves that greatness is not dependent on length or spectacle. Even a shorter menu delivers depth, confidence and emotional payoff.

üçù Olive Garden Times Square ‚Äî Comfort Italian Dining in the Heart of New York

One of the restaurants I chose for a proper sit-down meal during my time in Times Square, New York, was Olive Garden. After a full day of walking, sightseeing, and soaking in the energy of the city, this place felt like a comfortable and familiar stop for a hearty Italian-style dinner right in the middle of Manhattan.

Olive Garden is an Italian-American restaurant chain that was founded in 1982 in Florida, USA. The concept behind the brand is simple: serve Italian-inspired dishes that are generous in portion, rich in flavor, and easy to enjoy. Over the years, Olive Garden has grown into one of the most recognizable casual dining restaurants in the United States, and the Times Square location is especially popular among tourists from all over the world.

üìç Location
Olive Garden Times Square is located in the Theater District, just steps away from Times Square itself. The location is extremely convenient, whether you are coming from shopping areas, nearby attractions, or planning to watch a Broadway show. Several subway lines are within walking distance, making it very easy to reach.

üçù Must-Try Popular Dishes
One of the highlights of dining at Olive Garden is the complimentary Unlimited Breadsticks and House Salad. The warm breadsticks are soft, buttery, and addictive, while the fresh salad with the signature dressing is light and refreshing.

For main dishes, the most popular menu items include:
‚Ä¢	Fettuccine Alfredo, a classic favorite featuring flat pasta coated in a rich, creamy parmesan sauce
‚Ä¢	Chicken Parmigiana, breaded chicken topped with tomato sauce and melted cheese, served with spaghetti
‚Ä¢	Shrimp Scampi, saut√©ed shrimp with garlic and white wine sauce, offering a lighter and fresher taste
‚Ä¢	Lasagna Classico, layered pasta with meat sauce and cheese for those who want something filling

For dessert, Tiramisu is a top choice, offering a perfect balance of coffee flavor and creamy sweetness.

‚è∞ Opening Hours
Olive Garden Times Square is generally open daily from around 11:00 AM to 11:00 PM, though hours may be extended during weekends or peak tourist seasons.

üí∞ Prices
Considering the location and portion sizes, the prices are reasonable:
‚Ä¢	Main dishes usually range from $20 to $30
‚Ä¢	Desserts are around $8 to $10
‚Ä¢	The unlimited breadsticks and salad make the meal feel even more worth the price

üè° Atmosphere
The restaurant is spacious with plenty of seating, making it suitable for families, couples, and groups. Despite being in a busy area like Times Square, the interior feels warm and welcoming, with a casual Italian ambiance. The service is efficient and friendly, even during busy dinner hours.

‚ú® Final Thoughts

Olive Garden Times Square is a reliable choice if you are looking for a satisfying Italian-style meal in a comfortable setting. The food is hearty, the portions are generous, and the location is perfect for tourists. For anyone wanting a relaxed dinner after exploring New York City, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
