Whether you‚Äôre a local or just visiting Times Square, this Olive Garden is a fantastic choice for a relaxing and delicious Italian meal in the middle of the city‚Äôs excitement. I left completely happy and definitely planning to return soon.
Highly recommend! üçù‚ú®

Olive Garden used to be one of my favorite restaurants‚Äîgreat food, great ambiance‚Äîbut it‚Äôs definitely going downhill, or maybe it was just this specific location (Downtown Manhattan).

The place is huge, clearly designed to handle large crowds since it‚Äôs in the heart of a major tourist area. Although the restaurant was full, we were seated immediately, which was impressive.

We ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo, which was surprisingly bland‚Äîno flavor, not even salt. The lasagna tasted like a store-bought frozen meal: dry on the inside and drowned in a thick sauce that didn‚Äôt complement it well.

The main course came with a large shared salad and some breadsticks, both at no extra cost. When we asked for olive oil and butter, the staff brought them right away, again free of charge‚Äîwhich was appreciated.

I also ordered a beer and a margarita; my friend found the margarita overly sweet and hard to enjoy.

The highlight of the visit was definitely the service. Our waiter Anthony was outstanding‚Äîfriendly, knowledgeable, and very attentive. All the other staff were pleasant and professional too.

‚∏ª

Overall:
Great service, but unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt meet expectations. Hoping it was just an off day for this location.

For those of you who are disabled, this Olive Garden does have an elevator!! My mom and I came in at about 5-5:30pm-ish and were going to see Beetlejuice at the Palace Theatre at 7pm. We didn't have a reservation but they were able to seat us immediately. We told our server we were going to see a show at 7 and he was able make sure to get our food out fast. The food was great--I'm so glad they brought back the stuffed chicken marsala, it's my favorite menu item. And the service was great!

First time at Olive Garden. Got the unlimited pasta deal w/ my friends for the memes. Felt so sick after bc I ate so much - couldn‚Äôt eat any pasta for a month after üò≠ False fire alarm went off while we were here LMAO

- Never ending pasta bowl ($19.99): 5/10, could only eat 2 bowls of pasta + 1 bowl of soup. Tomato sauces >>> cheese sauces. The bread sticks are fire. Everything was too salty LOL, esp the meats

The place was nice, staff was friendly, food was very good. However, we specifically asked to not be rushed, we wanted to take our time. We were told that was no problem. The food came out minutes after we ordered it. We were rushed. I'm just tired of always being as a table to turn over for the next.

We came at around 9:30pm, and just did an appetizer night. We did The Grand which is an oyster tower with shrimp and spicy tuna tartare. It was amazing and great for 2ppl to share.

Then we did the Burrata, and Chicken Nuggets. The BREAD for the burrata was so great and warm, and the burrata itself was very milky.

Finally, living up to expectations so far - the Chicken nuggets were fresh, soft and perfectly breaded. Definitely not some generic frozen stuff.

Great first time experience here. Also the wine and cocktails are great.

Excellent brunch spot! We loved the fresh-squeezed orange juice, and both of our dishes hit the spot. The burger was juicy and flavorful, and the eggs, bacon, and potato pancake were cooked perfectly. Lively atmosphere and a solid choice for a relaxed weekend brunch.

First, Zack G did a wonderful job serving our group, friendly and quite helpful.  Our meals were nicely done as well.  I ordered the spicy shrimp scampi and it was very flavorfulnand I appreciated that it actually had a nice spice to it.  Only thought I'd offer is with such a nice looking bar would have preferred a martini with a little more substance - it was average.  All in all, we had a great experience.

Come for the sports, stay because the burger changed your life.
Honestly, usually "NYC sports bar" = "standing in someone‚Äôs armpit," but Stout is actually beautiful inside? The layout is great and the flow makes sense‚Äîyou aren't bumping into 50 people just to get to the restroom.
Great location near the Garden.
Love the cobblestone floors!
If you have eyeballs and like sports, this is the spot. The TV setup is elite; there isn't a bad seat in the house. Definitely check out the downstairs area too, it‚Äôs a whole vibe down there.
The staff were absolute legends‚Äîsuper friendly and fast. And whatever you do, order the smash burger. It was awesome. I might dream about it later.
Highly recommend!

After being ignored at another bar nearby, we decided to leave and come here instead and I‚Äôm really glad we did. The difference in service was immediate. Gaston was incredibly friendly, attentive, and genuinely welcoming from the moment we sat down. He went out of his way to help us get connected to the WiFi so we could get some work done from Stout, which was greatly appreciated. The WiFi itself worked very well and made it easy to stay productive while enjoying the space. Overall, great service, a comfortable atmosphere, and a big shoutout to Gaston for turning the experience into a great one. Would definitely come back

This place is a staple for my work group. We grab a drink and quick meal from this place nearly every time we meet in the city ‚Äî we‚Äôve tried other places but always end up back here. Good environment, good food, good drinks! We‚Äôre not even there for the sports, but there is definitely a sporty presence. Reasonably priced as well, which is super important.

Busy venue with a great atmosphere. The waitress that served us was great! I cannot recall her name, but she told me she could instantly tell when we were trying to get her attention. She had a great sense of humour and was "on the ball". Loved our visit. I will definitely go back.

We were looking for a place to have food and a drink. The security guy surprised us with the warmest welcome ever (quite rare in NYC to be honest). The amazing greetings already gave us a good vibe, and the food didn't disappoint at all. Delicious place I sincerely recommend!

Went on a Friday night and it was busy but the staff was very attentive . Great vibe .
I had the lychee martini and they were great. To eat I had the lobster tacos, shrimp tempura, the rice cake, tiradito and Toro roll. It was so delicious and I want to go again. Dishes are shareable. Very nice for a date night or just a night out with your girls/friends.

**went again 10/24** amazing service !  I love how they tell you how to eat the dish  and what‚Äôs part of each dish. Very clean and efficient service! Got sat at the counter but enjoyed watching the amazing chefs at work. Had the tiradito again and crispy rice. Lobster taco and wagyu taco, rock shrimp and the ribeye were all delicious. My bf loved the old fashion . Had the banana pudding for desert! Amazing

This is my husband and I‚Äôs third time at this Nobu location and the food is always perfection!! We were celebrating our anniversary and we couldn‚Äôt have chosen a better place! Service was impeccable, and we did not leave hungry! Definitely recommend to anyone in the area that wants an amazing meal! We will be back!

I recently had dinner at Nobu in New York and overall it was a very good experience. We had a reservation for 10 p.m. and still waited about ten minutes to be seated, which wasn‚Äôt too bad, but worth noting given how busy the restaurant stays. The atmosphere inside is sleek and modern, and the service was attentive without feeling rushed.
We started with drinks and ordered the Coconut Matcha and the Lychee Martini. The Coconut Matcha was smooth and lightly sweet, and I really enjoyed it. The Lychee Martini had a refreshing floral flavor but was a little strong for me, so I didn‚Äôt enjoy it quite as much.
For appetizers, the standout for me was the yellowtail sashimi with jalape√±o. It had a bright, slightly sour citrus note that paired perfectly with the subtle heat from the jalape√±o. It was easily my favorite dish of the night. We also tried the crispy rice with spicy tuna. The tuna itself was creamy and flavorful, but the rice was a bit too crispy for my taste and left the top of my mouth a little tender. The wagyu gyozas were good but underwhelming. They tasted similar to dumplings you can find anywhere and didn‚Äôt have the special richness I expected from wagyu.
The rock shrimp in creamy spicy sauce, however, were excellent. The shrimp were tender and coated in a sauce that had a great balance of creaminess and heat. The portion size was surprisingly generous compared to several of the other dishes, which felt on the smaller side.
We also ordered the chef‚Äôs recommendation of the night, a plate featuring twelve different pieces of sushi. Most of the pieces were very fresh and well prepared. A few had a slightly fishy taste that wasn‚Äôt my favorite, but overall it was an enjoyable selection and beautifully presented. Lastly I had dessert, it was super yummy! Forgot the name though..
In general, the food at Nobu is very good and the presentation is truly exceptional. My only hesitation is the pricing. Several of the portions feel quite small for the cost, and some dishes didn‚Äôt feel distinctive enough to justify the premium price tag. Still, the overall experience was memorable and worth trying at least once, especially if you appreciate refined Japanese cuisine with creative touches. We were a party of two and paid around $500.

Finally had the chance to try Nobu Fifty Seven and it lived up to the hype. We ordered the Yellowtail Jalape√±o, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, House Special Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll, and Spicy Tuna Roll. Every dish was fresh and full of flavor. I had been wanting to try the Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna for ages, and it absolutely did not disappoint!

We paired our dinner with two espresso martinis since we had a long night ahead. They were smooth and exactly what we wanted.

My only minor complaint was the table we were seated at had an overhead light tilted directly toward my face. It was much brighter than the rest of the room and a little distracting, especially since most of the restaurant had an intimate vibe.

Overall, Nobu Fifty Seven was a great experience. The food and drinks were excellent and I would definitely come back to try more.

Fantastic, my wife and I had dinner here for her birthday
Needed to schedule a few weeks in advance
The food was really great, we ordered variety of dishes and all were excellent!
The service is good, kind and helpful
Took two cocktails and a desert too
Tha place is beautiful
Very expensive though..
I recommend this place
............................................................................................................................................

We came on Christmas Eve and it was extremely crowded. The restaurant previously held a Michelin star, and after this visit, I can see why it might have lost it. Perhaps it was due to the holiday rush, but the service that night was fairly mediocre.

We ordered the white truffle pasta, $110 for 4g. While the presentation was fine, it definitely did not feel Michelin-level. The risotto was more enjoyable than the tagliatelle and had a much richer flavor.

For the starter, the Cannolicchio was quite creative, and the Astice was excellent!! The lobster was very bouncy, fresh, and sweet, and the burrata was rich and milky. Unfortunately, the Ricci was a big disappointment; the uni had a strong fishy taste and the quality was poor.

For the primi, we tried the Capellini, which I was really excited about but ended up disappointed. It was overly acidic, and the butter was not well incorporated. We also ordered half portions of the Pappardelle Granchio Reale and Fusilli, and surprisingly, these simpler pasta dishes were more enjoyable than the so-called signature ones.

For the main course, we chose the Anatra. It was already portioned when served, and the duck skin was beautifully crispy, one of the best dishes of the night.

We ordered two desserts and both were very good; I especially liked the tiramisu.

Overall, the portions here are quite generous. Some shortcomings help explain the lost star, but I would still recommend coming when it‚Äôs less crowded.

We had an extremely disappointing experience here as a group of four. Our bill was almost $900 including bottles of wine, so this was not a casual or low-spend visit.

Despite that, we were made to feel unwelcome towards the end of the evening. Staff began clearing our table without asking or receiving permission, while we were still seated. Shortly after, we were explicitly asked to leave because we had ‚Äúoverstayed,‚Äù even though no time limit had been communicated in advance. Also, they took forever to take our orders.

If there is a strict seating policy, it should be made clear upfront ‚Äî not enforced abruptly and rudely after guests have spent a significant amount of money. The way this was handled felt disrespectful. Being the only four brown people at the restaurant it totally felt discriminatory.

For a restaurant positioning itself at this price point, the service and hospitality fell far below expectations. We won‚Äôt be returning and would not recommend this place to others looking for a welcoming dining experience. We did bring this up to the management and they seemed more interested in getting the credit card charged right away and did not offer any significant apologies. Our server ( Robert) was actually nice but his service could not make up for how the evening turned out overall.

Elegant dining experience.  Bring your credit cards!

We just had dinner here. The food was good overall. The main server was good.

Three separate people asked us if we wanted water before someone actually brought us water‚Ä¶.

We ordered the duck for our main course.  The server placed the rare duck in front of the wrong diner, even after we asked about cooking level.

The food overall is elegant and the wine list expansive.

Sort of odd Marea did not offer an amuse bouche or anything else.

Marea is a solid place; consistently delightful, albeit pricey. The standout dishes for me were the Bronzino tartar and the tagliatelle (without the truffles). The grilled Bronzino and scallops were okay. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the scampi croquette (though others in my group raved about the sardines).

Our server was wonderful and intuitive as were the other main staff. Some hiccups with the support staff (e.g. repeatedly mixing up still and sparkling water, taking long to clear crumbs off the table, small things like that - but that‚Äôs okay). Overall I very much recommend and will be back

Marea completely lived up to the hype. Incredible seafood, flawless execution, and a warm, sophisticated atmosphere. Every bite was memorable, and the service made the experience feel effortless. One of those restaurants you keep thinking about after you leave

I visited this restaurant to celebrate my birthday, and everything was wonderful from start to finish. We were welcomed at the table with decorative touches that made the evening feel extra special. The appetizers were delicious, the cocktails were excellent, and the steak was cooked perfectly‚Äîwe loved it.
A special thank you to Edgar, who went above and beyond to make our night memorable. We truly appreciate his help and kindness. Highly recommended!

We came as walk-ins and were very grateful that we were seated right away. Our server, Maria, was very sweet; however, overall the wait staff was not at the level expected of a fine dining establishment. Their English was quite poor. The service itself was excellent, and thanks to Maria for her food recommendations.

One thing I would point out is that the hostesses do not seem to have a proper dress code for a place like this‚Äîit‚Äôs really not appropriate to see a hostess wearing UGG boots and a gray T-shirt.
Everything was amazing. From food - to drinks - to service - to the thoughtful and delicious dessert they included for my birthday!

Looked around places in NYC for a burger and drink at a bar.  The Capital Grill really delivered. Service is so much better, staff friendly & helpful. Bathrooms were really clean and multiple team member asking if we need anything else. Wagyu & Wine was a great deal and glad I stopped by!

Started with fresh oysters. Best steak I‚Äôve ever had. Highly recommend the bone in ribeye accompanied Sam‚Äôs mashed potatoes and the grilled asparagus and the service was impeccable. Delaney and the rest of the staff elevated the whole experience. Will definitely come back again and tell my friends to come if they ever have the chance

Went jere because of the (loose) connection to the tv show.
We didn't book a table and went in on the last Saturday before Christmas, we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table.
The service was great and friendly, the food was amazing really tasty and was probably the only homemade style meal we had in New York.
I felt the overall bill was a little high, but ypu get what you pay for.
We all really enjoyed it and would go back again.

My cousin and I came to this pub during out holiday and I can‚Äôt rate it high enough! I want to give a special thank you to Joy, Andrew, Allison, Justine and Ciara who made us both feel so welcome, they laughed and joked with us, looked after us extremely well. It was as good a service we could ask for‚Ä¶ so we came back every night of our trip! When we came in the second time Joy, one of the bartenders, immediately recognised us and started laughing and having jokes with us right away, and getting us both a beer just as quick! Andrew was also just as brilliant, having jokes with us all night, making sure we both had plenty to drink, and giving us brilliant recommendations off the menu. Allison, Justine and Ciara are also just as amazing, their hard work didn‚Äôt go unnoticed to us both and yet again they joined in with the laughing and joking, even teaching us some American jokes!! Some amazing memories have been made here purely down to how excellent the staff are here, I could not recommend it higher

üîü / üîü

Hello, we have been here 3 times.

I am always amazed by this beautiful and idyllic bar.

There is delicious food and drinks of all kinds here.

I'm a huge fan of "How I Met your Mother" and that's why this bar is a must on every New York trip.

I love this fantastic atmosphere.

It always feels good to be here, where the idea for 'How I Met your Mother' came from.

You can be sure that you can expect first-class service here, very friendly and accommodating.

Good price-performance ratio.

Be sure to come here, it's worth it every time.

That wasn't the last time we were here.

We will definitely be coming back 100%.

Highly recommended.

Until next time and have fun here.

‚úåüèª‚úåüèª‚úåüèª

I‚Äôm a huge fan of How I Met Your Mother, and I had been wanting to come to this place for a long time. I absolutely loved the experience. The drinks were delicious, and the bartender was very attentive. There was no waiting time since I sat at the bar. The atmosphere was warm and welcoming.

you‚Äôre a big fan of How I Met Your Mother, you have to check out this experience. You totally feel the McLaren‚Äôs vibe! You HAVE to try the special drinks from the show. I tried the Robin Sparkles and it gave me sparkles at the end üòù

restaurant_name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
review_text: My friends and I got Richard as a waiter and he was very helpful with food options. Him and his coworker were nice enough to give us a free dessert. It was a pleasure.

restaurant_name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
review_text: Booked here to catch up with friends and grab some lunch before heading to the airport. This dinner had a great selection of drinks and hearty classics at good value. Would recommend the burgers and golden fingers. Great service from the staff with recommendations that we tried and enjoyed.

restaurant_name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
review_text:
A great place for $5.00 happy hour daily from 4:30 to 7:00 pm daily for five different type of  drinks from a 22 ounce light beer to Long Island iced tea.

The floor area adjacent to the restaurant is for those who love to play a large variety of games for all adults and children.

I would have liked to see appetizers added to happy hour instead of filling in a receipt survey on the back of your bill payment.

This will get you a free $20.00 appetizer with purchase of a main menu item when you return.

restaurant_name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
review_text: We booked a table to watch the UFC fights on Saturday night. They have plenty of TVs. When we arrived, they sat us in front of one that wasn‚Äôt currently showing what we came for, and it took them 20-ish minutes to switch it over. By the time the main fights were on, almost every TV was playing UFC. Service was great. Food was okay. Of the two finger foods we ordered (Philly egg rolls and boneless wings), they were mildly overcooked, dry, and overpriced. You‚Äôre paying for the space, not the food.

restaurant_name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
review_text: Food is pretty good at this location. D&B sometimes has some good promotions going on like $5 Margs and $10 wings. Sundays and Wednesdays (I believe) games are half off.

Went for Restaurant Week ($60 per person). The food and drinks were incredible. Three course meal of the most delicious food. Well prepared and beautiful. The restaurant was gorgeous and the service was great. I would love to come back here again. The highlight for me was the Butternut Squash Soup. It was so good! The portion sizes were perfect for me.

Absolutely loved our experience at Ai Fiori. The flower decorations and overall ambiance are beautiful, elegant, warm, and inviting. The food was outstanding: the lobster bisque was rich and flavorful, and both the Maine lobster and the ink squid dishes were absolutely delicious. Even the coffee was excellent.

Special shoutout to Ismail, our server, who provided exceptional service, attentive, warm, and professional. Everyone we encountered was friendly, and the hospitality was truly top-notch. A wonderful dining experience from start to finish. Highly recommend.

Located inside the hotel, Ai Fiori is a great spot for business lunch or dinner.
From the ambience to service to food, it was excellent!
Lobster bisque was rich and tasty. Tuna tartar was beautifully presented and all the ingredients were harmonious.
Pasta was cooked perfectly and kept the temperature until the last bite.
Service was efficient and our waiter went above and beyond.
When you are in the city, definitely visit Ai Fiori.

Excellent choice for a business dinner. Ai Fiori delivers a refined dining experience with exceptional service, elegant ambiance, and perfectly executed dishes. The setting allows for great conversation without noise, and the staff strikes the right balance of professionalism and warmth. Ideal spot to impress clients or host an executive meal in NYC. üç∑üçΩÔ∏è

Where do I even start? First of all, the service was amazing. Our server was so unbelievably kind and gave amazing suggestions on what we should get. All her recs were spot on!! Second of all - the food. Wow. I got the Passera E Caviale which apparently has been on the menu for the past 10 years. I hope it stays on the menu for another 10 years. So flavorful, light, perfect - I‚Äôll never forget that first bite. I also got the spaghetti and duck, both were cooked to perfection. The duck especially was very juicy and tender. No complaints!! I highly recommend!!

A bit pricey but good.. also good atmosphere..we sat upstairs..I had NY Strip with mushrooms and fries which was enjoyable.   Calamari appetizer was very good as well.. also large choice of bottled wine for $45 flat, which is not too bad for NYC

Had the most amazing dinner, felt like we were back in Italy. Service is excellent and prompt. Our waiter was superb. Not to mention the food! Veal piccata, chicken Parm, and incredible pastas !!! If you are in NYC go hungry and enjoy! This classic old school recipes that do not disappoint!

Amazing restaurant. Called to reserve two hours before and they were able to accommodate us. Great service, great food!! Love the all you can eat pasta!! It‚Äôs $36.95 for a caesar salad or vegetables, and all you can eat 3 types of pastas!!! Definitely will go back!! Delicious!!

Wonderful, authentic experience.  Food was great! I was there with my coworkers after a conference.  We had enough space for 15 at our long table and the room was quiet enough for us all to talk.  Definitely a place to come back too if opportunity comes up.

It was good, just nothing exceptional. The salmon was perfectly cooked, the calamari and Caesar salad was very tasty. The brussel sprouts under the salmon were mushy. The pumpkin soup needed salt and the baked pumpkin chips they give on the side turned mushy after a minute. It was the holiday season so  very crowded, very busy. The server was meh. The vibe was, he would have been much happier if I had been spending $100 more which is funny because he forgot to bring the wine. At least it wasn't on the bill.

This is a great casual spot for drinks after work. They have a ‚Äúgirl dinner‚Äù special rn for $25 fries, salad, pasta and a drink. Great deal amazing service by Aaron as well. Will definitely be coming back.

Nothing more convenient than seeing the Rockefeller Christmas Tree and walking a block away to this fabulous restaurant. The place was decorated just beautifully. The 4 of us each had steak for dinner. My friend and I had the Prime Rib steak cooked to perfection and LOVED the tasty rub on it. Of the other couple one had Short Ribs and the other had Petite Filet Mignon.  They said it was EXCELLENT as well ! We ordered a couple of ‚Äúsides‚Äù to share and shared a fabulous Cookie Crumble Sundae that was out of this world. We all loved the whole experience being at DelFrisco‚Äôs!!

Yesterday my partner and i went to Del Frisco's for dinner. Immediately met with the hostess who was extremely pleasant. We were seated immediately. Our waiter, forgot his name, was really nice and patient. He checked up on us  consistently but not overbearing. The manager, Marcus, also stopped by our table to check in, and we had a small chat about the snowstorm that was hidden NYC the next day. You can tell that he cared about the restaurants customers by the way he spoke. The food was excellent, especially the cheesesteak eggrolls. We were celebrating an anniversary and we were bought a cheesecake, two shots.,  and a lovely card. This was a memory that will always remain. Thank you Del Frisco's for a wonderful experience. We will be back in the near future.

This was a 7/10, came here for my brothers bday, there was like almost no space to walk by the seats were literally not even an inch apart of another persons seat.. but then again we went during peak hours so I can‚Äôt complain. The food was also mid. I would recommend for drinks.

Went for Thanksgiving dinner. It was fine. Plate could've been larger for the cost, but the cuisine was pretty standard. Ambiance was nice. I was seated in a quieter corner, which I appreciated. Server was also fine, though I waited 10-15 minutes to pay once I had the check. Nothing remarkable in the positive or negative.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
An unforgettable dining experience at Eleven Madison Park!

From the moment I walked in, everything felt meticulously crafted ‚Äî elegant yet welcoming. The service was beyond exceptional: attentive, warm, and incredibly knowledgeable. Every course was a piece of art, balancing creativity with flavor in a way that only Eleven Madison Park can achieve.

What impressed me most was the restaurant‚Äôs commitment to plant-based cuisine without sacrificing luxury or depth. Each dish told a story ‚Äî from the delicate textures to the thoughtful plating ‚Äî and the flavors were bold, surprising, and deeply satisfying. The wine pairings elevated the experience even further.

The atmosphere is serene and sophisticated, with every detail designed to enhance the meal. By the end of the evening, it didn‚Äôt feel like just dinner; it felt like being part of a masterpiece.

A particularly memorable highlight was being personally invited into the kitchen ‚Äî an extraordinary gesture that offered a glimpse into the artistry and discipline behind each creation. The team‚Äôs professionalism and passion were unmistakable, making the experience even more inspiring.

If you‚Äôre looking for an experience that‚Äôs both inspiring and indulgent, Eleven Madison Park is truly one of the world‚Äôs finest.

EMP has been on my bucket list for a long time. When I found out they were featuring meat courses again, I was ecstatic because we happen to be in town. I was lucky enough to grab one of their bar tasting menu reservations. We‚Äôve had the privilege to dine at many Worlds Best and Michelin starred restaurants around the world, so I had extremely high hopes.

The courses were good, but nothing really wowed me. I wish they offered less vegan courses. Since we do not drink alcohol, I was surprised to see a non-alcoholic wine pairing. I opted for it ($135) bc I was intrigued, but I would not get it again. The white pairings were delicious, but the red pairings all tasted sour and left a bad aftertaste. I only had a sip. Service was exceptional, I did not expect anything less. For the price, I would rather go to Per Se or Le Bernardin.

Came here for a birthday celebration!
It was amazing! The staff was so on point, I didn‚Äôt even know when they were refilling my glass with water.
So happy there is Meat on the menu again!

The team was great, they work so well together. It was an army there!

A shout out to Brandon. And the staff member that heard me when I said ‚Äúoh I would love another one of those‚Äù then there it was another one!

We will be back for the next menu

It makes me sad to share that I had an underwhelming experience here last night. I dined at Eleven Madison Park with high expectations, and unfortunately the experience fell short of what a restaurant of this reputation should deliver. This visit was especially meaningful, as it was both my birthday and New Year‚Äôs Eve, and EMP has long been my number one must-try restaurant in the world.

I‚Äôve worked in the service industry for a decade and have read Unreasonable Hospitality multiple times. I truly admire the philosophy behind this book, which made this experience even more disappointing.

From the beginning, we felt rushed. We were hurried over to our table 20 minutes before our reservation when we had hoped for a drink at the upstairs bar first. Our table was shoved in a corner and was lacking white table cloths/more elegant settings since we were seated at a bar table. The first course arrived before our cocktails, which threw off the pacing of the meal and felt very rushed.

One particularly surprising moment was when my soup was poured into my water glass instead of the proper vessel. I was sad that more soup was not brought to replenish my serving as it was delicious, but I feel I missed about a quarter of the serving from the faux pas.

I was very disappointed that the duck was removed from the tasting menu for the night as this was a course I have been fantasizing about trying for over a year. I was excited it was supposed to be back now that the restaurant is no longer vegan.

Dessert arrived frozen solid, we could not break into it. My date‚Äôs dessert went flying off his plate from his effort to cut into it, so it had to be replaced. While mistakes can happen anywhere, experiencing this many issues at a restaurant that holds three Michelin stars was genuinely underwhelming.

What stood out most was the service overall. The servers felt over-rehearsed and burnt out, like they were just going through the motions rather than offering genuine hospitality. I believe this is why so many mistakes were made. My date remarked that the staff felt very green, but my feeling was that holiday burn out was wearing everyone thin.

At this price point, and at a three-Michelin-star level, the experience should feel thoughtful, seamless, and warm. Instead, it felt rushed and mechanical, lacking the care and attention to detail that make a meal truly special. I am hopeful that these rare mistakes can be addressed and corrected for future diners to better enjoy the experience I had anticipated for so long.

Incredible incredible incredible evening. Best Dinner in a decade. Went here for my 5th wedding anniversary and my wife and I were floored by all the surprise and delights. We had both read ‚Äúunreasonable hospitality‚Äù, so we were familiar with the vision of the space. but it blew away every expectation we had. Huge thanks to our amazing server Kalem Scott, Marina our greeter and Chloe our Kitchen Tour guide that showed us behind the scenes. Book a reservation here as soon as you can. They pull out all the stops. We even got to meet Chef Daniel Humm.

Really lovely place to dine! Food is delicious and staff is amazing. Host staff is one of the best in the city! The burger is divine, but don‚Äôt miss out on the seasonal pastas either! And you can‚Äôt miss the chocolate chip cookie with milk. They have a coat check as well which is really nice.

Would definitely recommend you have a reservation or look for seating at the bar.

Excellent dinner from start to finish.
The seasonal menu was thoughtful and well executed, with great balance and high-quality ingredients. The lamb main was cooked perfectly and full of flavor, and the overall pacing of the meal felt just right. Desserts were refined and not overly sweet. Professional service and a relaxed, elegant atmosphere. Would definitely return.

From start to finish, this was the best dining experience my now wife and I have ever had. We‚Äôre on our honeymoon, and having each worked over a decade in hospitality, this being our first Michelin-star experience set the bar impossibly high.Our server Michael was exceptional‚Äîwarm, personable, and spot-on with both dinner and drink recommendations and suggestions for a perfect nightcap afterward. Luka paired wines beautifully with our mid course and mains, elevating each course effortlessly. Chef Michael even came out to chat with us about the industry and mutual connections back home, and surprised us with a lobster and truffle bite that was nothing short of incredible.Every single dish was sublime. The dirty martini (with pickle brine) was the best we‚Äôve ever had. Even their simple red pepper and cashew starter was just shockingly good, and the seafood platter was absolutely worth it. From the yellowtail to the gnocchi and squid ink caramelle, every course hit. The pork loin and belly and the sirloin were both outstanding. Dessert sealed the night‚Äîthe cherry chocolate dessert, followed by little chocolates to finish with a hummingbird cake. They even sent us off with something special to enjoy the next morning, which we can‚Äôt wait to enjoy.Flawless hospitality, thoughtful touches, and unforgettable food. An experience we‚Äôll remember for the rest of our lives.

‚ÄúOne of the best burgers in NYC ‚Äî easily.‚Äù
Both my wife and I ordered the burger and we were extremely happy with it. It comes with an aioli sauce that makes the whole combination absolutely unmatched. Juicy, flavorful, and perfectly put together.

The restaurant itself is beautiful and has a great atmosphere. It‚Äôs really hard to get a reservation, but you can walk in and sit at the bar ‚Äî we waited about 30 minutes for a spot. The staff was very friendly and welcoming.

We had a wonderful experience and will definitely be coming back.

We had lunch at Gramercy Tavern on Sunday with a group of four, seated in the Tavern area rather than the formal dining room. The cocktails were a fantastic start‚Äîabsolutely 5 out of 5. The staff was warm and attentive, and the atmosphere was lively and welcoming.

The flatbread was excellent, one of the highlights of the meal. But overall, I was hoping for a bit more from the rest of the food. We tried the burger, pork shoulder, swordfish, tomato salad, and liver mousse. While some dishes were fine, the burger and pork shoulder in particular were disappointing and just didn‚Äôt hit the mark. The salad and mousse also felt a little ordinary.

For a place with such a strong reputation‚Äîand at this price point‚ÄîI expected the dishes to shine more. Still, the service and vibe were wonderful, which made the experience enjoyable overall.

If I had to rate it: 5 stars for service and ambiance, but about 3 stars for the food, so overall a solid 3 stars.

My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful breakfast at The Lambs Club. From start to finish, the experience was flawless. The service was top notch ‚Äî the staff were warm, attentive, and made sure everything was perfect without ever being intrusive. The food was incredibly fresh, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The coffee was strong and perfectly brewed, just the way a morning should start.

The atmosphere truly sets The Lambs Club apart ‚Äî from the elegant furniture to the historic photos on the walls, every detail exudes character and sophistication. You can feel the rich history of the place paired seamlessly with genuine hospitality.

A perfect breakfast experience in every way ‚Äî highly recommend to anyone looking for a memorable and refined start to their day.

Our reservation was at 7pm and was able to get seat on time. The staff were friendly and helpful. Once we ordered, food came in decent time. The duck was tender and melts in your mouth. The scallops were delicious but too creamy for my taste. Otherwise we enjoyed the food and experience.
Great spot for dinner before a show. They are very thoughtful on timing and service is impeccable. Food is prefix and tasty but not extraordinary. Still very good experience near broadway

Absolutely delightful dinner at the Lambs Club NYC ü•∞
The lamb (as expected) was exquisite. I also had the steak tartar with caviar. I have not had caviar in a while, so that was such a treat! ü•∞

Special thanks to Lydia who has been very attentive and accommodating. Definitely a five-star experience!

This restaurant felt like a sexy scene out of a movie, or something you‚Äôd experience in Palm Springs. The fireplace is inviting, the leather ‚Äúdiner‚Äù seating felt luxurious not campy, and overall the restaurant was quiet enough to have a conversation without shouting (on a Wednesday night at 8 pm). The service made me feel like a celebrity and the food was impeccable. 10/10!

Tiny but mighty! You can tell the owner knows what he is doing. If I remember correctly, the guy there is the son of the former owner. My second visit was today and it didn‚Äôt disappoint! The owner and the staff were very helpful and nice.

I had the Zen Mandu Bowl (totally a Star Wars sounding name-lol). It has all vegetarian steamed potstickers, plenty of veg, kimchi with a lovely sauce; cool and refreshing. I could only eat because I also had a delicious shake made out beets and other yummy things ($9.25). So refreshing! Prices at pretty typical for NYC and so many options.

They also have a few hot and cold chicken and turkey options today. Wraps and Turkey meatballs‚Ä¶looked delicious but I wanted fresh vegetables. They also have veggie friendly cookies, chips, Ollipop, and other things.

They also had lentil soup, chicken soup and I forget what the third soup was. My friend had the chicken soup.

Sadly, the lovely sorbetto that was here earlier in the year! Next time , I‚Äôll have to ask about it!

Food felt a little small, but it was a good price! Love to see so many vegan options along with normal food. Plus it had a cute interior and some phantom of the opera pictures! For Times Square, this is a good stop for healthy food

What a great find!!!! So nice to find a place with so many vegan options. I wanted to try it all! Service and friendly staff were exceptional and the food incredibly delicious. Wait time was minimal with a small seating area. Perfect to order and go or stay in to munch. Prices were reasonable. Seriously, you won't be disappointed. This has been added to one of our favorite NYC spots to grab something healthy and tasty on the go. Wish we had found it sooner. Will definitely be back!
A friend said this was his favorite place for healthy food and it didn‚Äôt disappoint!  I had the Protein A√ßa√≠ bowl with almond butter, delicious!  Sad to hear that this spot is closing down.

Lots of really tasty looking vegetarian options! I went with the yummy vegetarian wrap and I'm happy to say that it was actually delicious! However, it kind of fell apart while I was eating it - the wrap wasn't strong enough to hold the contents without tearing. Would definitely still order again, though! Just letting you know that it can be a bit of a messy dining experience.

The staff was very friendly and helpful! They made recommendations, which I always love to hear.

Tip: They have a limited seating area! So if you show up during lunch hours, plan to take your food with you. They can probably seat up to 12 people in their seating area.

A true find and an easy walk from nearby hotels. We shared the tomato caprese and I Rigatoni (chicken, sausage and pasta in a cream sauce). The tiramisu and mini canoli were great! Service was very good. Prices are reasonable.

I am such a hard sell!! But they exceeded expectations. You have to be careful because in time square you can get non sense resturants. I really enjoyed the food and our service.

SERVICE:  Pedro is a fun server and really good at his job. He had a really nice way of adapting to the personalities of each each table. Yes I am nosey so I noticed.

FOOD: The claims were good, just a little fishy for my mood but my partner really like it. We shared the Alfredo and the noddles taste like they are in hous home made and the sauce too. We ordered extra chicken too. The portion is a single size portion so you can eat it alone. I nust wanted less food yesterday.

AMBIENCE: the only thing is the christmas garlins slipped down behind us, but the place is cute quaint and inviting.

Thank you, I am a new yorker that left a while ago, so it was nice to come home and have this gem

A very cozy restaurant! The atmosphere is lovely and the wait staff are very knowledgeable. The prices are incredibly fair considering you‚Äôre in the heart of the theatre district. I believe the carpaccio was $18, and our pasta dishes were $25-35 each. I would definitely come back! The squid ink pasta was incredible 10/10!!

Probably worth booking especially at a weekend.
It was very busy.
The chap on reception was doing an incredible job. We were told the wait would be 30 minutes and received a call to say our table was ready.
We were seated upstairs which was larger than I expected. I personally would not have liked Downstairs seating as there were people waiting everywhere inside for a table, perfect if you like people watching tho!!
The meal was delicious,  we had breadsticks to start, two each, then a salad and then the main. Mine was chicken plus spaghetti on the side, huge. Portion sizes are so generous in New York,  we could easily share a meal.
I couldn't fault the service.
We even had a wonderful view of the Christmas huts from our table.
I would throughly recommend and book as popular!!

This Italian spot near Times Square is such a gem! The location is perfect, and the atmosphere makes it a wonderful place to enjoy a meal in the city. The pasta was fresh, homemade, and absolutely delicious‚Äîtrue comfort food. The mozzarella was to die for, rich and creamy, and paired perfectly with the dishes. Even the complimentary bread was fresh and so tasty, I could have eaten a whole basket! The drinks were refreshing and balanced everything out perfectly. A lovely dining experience all around‚ÄîI can‚Äôt wait to go back!

restaurant_name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Park Avenue New York City
review_text: Not what we expected. We‚Äôve been to the branch in the Times building and the one downtown. Those restaurants are grand with huge ceilings and are filled with light while the noise easily floats upwards and disappears‚Ä¶this one is nothing like that though the barrel ceilings are nice. The tables are close but not on top of each other at the other branches but the park avenue site seems to have added too many tables and if you have claustrophobia maybe you should avoid. The waiters station was next to our table and a waiter dropped the giant metal peppermill on one of our party. Accidents happen but upon being informed there were no apologies or any change of behavior or environment‚Ä¶it didnt happen again but very nearly did multiple times. The rudeness was prevalent, the bartender serving us drinks while we waited for our table was a piece of work. Upset that we werent going to eat at the bar and provide him with a fatter tip mocked us for asking to see a menu and not using it. The rudeness at Lugers in Brooklyn or the old Durgin Park in Boston was part of the experience and charm‚Ä¶sadly here it was just poor customer service. Our waiters at the table and the hostesses were more than pleasant but the rest probably should not work in the service industry. The food was why we came and the tuna and bacon and bread and sides were all as expected. The steaks however felt more tough and unaged then they should have been. We thought we were eating much cheaper steaks. The presentation was exactly as expected but the quality of all of our steaks felt more Outback than Manhattan steak house. I would love to revisit this review but after spending over $250 per person for this very average meal with less than average service it is unlikely.

restaurant_name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Park Avenue New York City
review_text: My most favorite restaurant! Steak!!! Tuna is unbelievable! Excellent chopped salad, good bread. Chocolate mousse cake is to die for. But steak is the number 1 reason to come! Excellent professional service, nice pleasant atmosphere. Of course you pay a lot for this experience, but it is worth it! Highly highly recommend this outstanding restaurant!

restaurant_name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Park Avenue New York City
review_text: Nick was our server and he was wonderful! Very personable and helpful on the menu. My brother and I had a wonderful time. As a former New Yorker I twas nice to come to a place that treates you like a local. Food was delicious as expected. We had ribeye and una tartare and veggie platter. Drinks were solid as well.

restaurant_name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Park Avenue New York City
review_text: We went on Christmas Day and the place was packed. Everything about this restaurant is perfect. From the moment we stepped inside. The service was impeccable. The food was delicious and plentiful. The gorgeous ceilings and decor were stunning. Would recommend if you love steak. Plus it is wheelchair accessible.

restaurant_name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse - Park Avenue New York City
review_text: Not very friendly for a solo traveler. Although I had made a reservation for a table, they sat me at the bar. The bar menu was still full price. The bartender was friendly and inviting, but it wasn‚Äôt the holiday meal I had envisioned. The bread was cold. My steak was cooked perfectly. No dessert menu was offered. The value was questionable.

Sat at the bar for Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra. Wonderful and awesome. Had amaretto coffee drinks and cheesecake bc we had already eaten dinner. Dessert chef is amazing, best cheesecake ive ever had. Very fluffy and delicious. Barkeep said desserts were the shining stars of menu.

We had an amazing evening at this jazz club! The atmosphere was vibrant yet cozy, with incredible live music that set the perfect tone for the night. The musicians were extremely talented and kept the crowd entertained from start to finish.
Dinner was just pretty tasty‚Äîwe had lasagna and Cajun jambalaya. The service was excellent too: friendly, attentive, and made the whole experience seamless.
It‚Äôs not easy to find a place that combines great food, top-notch live music, and a welcoming vibe, but this spot does it all. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a fun and memorable night out!

Amazing experience! Saw a big band play. Loved every minute of it! You can order a full dinner while you‚Äôre there plus drinks. Huge portions but a bit heavy. But hey, you‚Äôre there for the music right? Service was pretty good - coming by between sets.

Definitely worth making the effort to stop by. Decent bathrooms.

Such a wonderful place with great vibes and tasty food. The live performance by the drummer, pianist, and double bassist was fantastic!
I left my clothes there by mistake, and even though they were busy, a kind lady took the time during the performance break to find them for me. I really appreciated her kindness. I‚Äôd love to come back again someday.

Amazing experience - strong drinks, friendly service and great music. We didn‚Äôt have any food because vegan options were not exciting at all but still had a lovely evening with great cocktails. Would definitely recommend booking this experience in advance and also coming early if you want nice seats!

Had lunch at Fig & Olive for the first time today and was very impressed, I see why this place is packed all of the time as the food is delicious! Had the tuna sandwich in particular, and it was out of this world. The service at the bar was fantastic, too. We'll definitely be returning to Fig & Olive in the near future. Highly recommended!

5pm starts seating upstairs. They have a few appetizers and small plates and entrees. They are all pretty small so good for one person or get multiple to share. We had a light bite. Beet humus and the lamb & couscous with the fig and olive drink. All was amazing flavors and the right amount of spices.

Great fresh food at this location. Went for birthday Lunch for my daughter and she really enjoyed herself. We had the most amazing waiter in the world. He was so engaging and made us all feel like we alone at the restaurant and he was just giving us too notch service. Kudos! We tried a wide variety of appetizers and entrees and every single one was delicious. The dips are all amazing they are a must try. Definitely recommend if your in the area. I will definitely be coming back to try the dinner menu. Cheers!

Good Mediterranean Food I had in a while.
1. Definitely try to truffle croquettes!
One of the best croquettes I had
2. Good ingredients
their olive oil is really fresh and amazing, making their food also amazing.
3. Wait time was too long
It took 40minutes from appetizers plates taken from main dish served.

Dining at Fig & Olive was such a pleasant experience from start to finish.

Every single item on the menu is crafted to perfection with the highest quality ingredients, intricately added to each dish. Everything is there for a reason and tastes absolutely amazing.

Even the salad was one of the best salads we ever had.

Keep in mind that the food takes some time to prepare, but I guess that‚Äôs how you know that everything is being made fresh!

Do not miss Fig & Olive!

Delicious food, friendly staff, and great prices! Plenty of options for me that were gluten free, dairy free, and soy free. A bit loud for my taste but it was a great experience. Thrilled by the guava smoothie. The staff that greeted us were warm. Luiza, our server, was nice and attentive. The people that came to our table with waters, our orders, and to pick up dishes were so friendly too. And did I mention the delicious food?! Thanks to entire team - from the front end to the kitchen and everyone in between. Definitely recommend! üëè

Visited Friday night for happy hour. Our wait to get a table was 50 minutes. Instead we went to the bar and were lucky that guest left and we had availability for 2 seats. Our server Israel made our transition smoothly and quick. We order various appetizers and drinks. Beer Pacifico and Blue moon
.Drinks passion fruit mojito with fresh sugar cane and mint. The band was there tuning their sound for a while but once they got it together they played a set of various song not limited to Cuban music.  Overall it was good atmosphere and food.  I liked the green sauce instead of f the mayo sauce drizzle all over out appetizers. I've been to the LI Havana central which i visited various times and they also ha e live bands and delicious food.

The night I went to Havana Central was my first time in New York City and he made my experience even greater. The food was absolutely excellent. I live in California and I've tried a few Cuban places and this one was one of the best. The young man who served me was outstanding super Pleasant and very attentive I forget his name I wish I could remember it all I know is that he is very young thin half Mexican half Salvadorian but he made my experience a Havana Central the more pleasant. I love the atmosphere the decorations the happiness of the people celebrating and even though they were super busy everyone seem to be having a great time. If you ever go to New York City you must try Havana Central.
We loved this place! I went with 3 friends and we received a great service by Rafaela. Food was delicious and great size portions, my favorite was the ropa vieja. Will definitely come back!

The food was scrumptious!! I went for the first time after seeing the broadway play Buena Vista Social Club. We ordered the corn and empanadas for starters‚Ä¶let me just say we cleared the plates. It could have stopped there and I would have been pleased but no it kept getting better. I had steak with the shrimp in butter garlic sauce, my cousin had the snapper. Service was friendly and fast. Drinks were strong and the price was compatible plus totally worth it. Portions were large, I had take home enough for a second meal. Sorry for my pictures in advance lol Listen‚Ä¶I‚Äôll be back

I recently visited this restaurant and was thoroughly impressed. The ambiance is quiet and beautiful, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing meal. The service is exceptional, with attentive and friendly staff who ensure you have everything you need. The display of the dishes is excellent, showcasing the chef‚Äôs attention to detail and creativity. The meals themselves are special, with unique flavors and high-quality ingredients that make each bite a delight. It‚Äôs definitely worth trying if you‚Äôre looking for a memorable dining experience.

This is the place you want to find in a trip. Sometimes it is difficult to find healthy food. This place was simply perfect, hundreds options to lunch time. My sister and me suffer to find places to eat healthy and this place made our day.

This is one of the few salads I genuinely enjoy and can eat every day, and it really helps me stay consistent with my intake control, especially when I‚Äôm on a lunch break and trying to avoid pizza or other heavy, high-calorie options.

I most often get the Cali Cobb with hot sauce, sometimes with crispy chicken as a treat, and it‚Äôs always solid. The manager and staff are very nice and friendly.

Their breakfast guacamole toast is good too, but I usually stick with the same salad.

Fast service and balanced ingredients.

Today, I had the pleasure of visiting Fresh & Co., and it was an amazing experience! ü•ûüç≥ For breakfast, they offer a variety of incredibly delicious dishes that truly stand out, and their dinner options are just as impressive! üç¥‚ú® The atmosphere is not only clean and beautifully designed, but the staff is also super friendly and welcoming, making you feel right at home. üòäüåø If you‚Äôre looking for fresh, flavorful meals served with a smile, this is the perfect spot! üíöüçΩ Definitely a must-visit for food lovers

The food is amazing it is all fresh and the flavours are amazing, it got us ready for our busy day ahead. My favourite was the power BLT with a tea and a dash of honey with milk and bowl of fruit, Greek yogurt or a smoothy, everything was too good we had to try it all and it didn‚Äôt disappoint it was amazing and tasty. We had breakfast there everyday when we visited New York. Everyone is really friendly and we were always welcomed and Everett is amazing he is very welcoming and friendly always welcoming us, made sure we are okay and had great conversations.

Went out with my friends the other night for a fun girls night out, I love STK. They have always been very consistent and the atmosphere is fun with an upbeat vibe great music, excellent cocktails.
I had the filet mignon which was cooked to perfection. The shrimp cocktail was amazing and the shrimps were large. I love their bread with the dipping sauce. Our server Christian was amazing. He made sure we got everything we wanted and explained the menu and drinks very thoroughly. I found parking right out front, which was a plus can‚Äôt wait to go back. They even have a cool video Photo Booth at the front for your social media, which was awesome ! Oh and the bag of donuts with the dipping sauce or a must for dessert !!!

My boyfriend and I came here last night for a fancy dancy romantic dinner date just shy of Christmas üéÑ I was looking at steakhouses that had very nice reviews and the STK franchise was a fan favorite. The Midtown location was more convenient to commute to and had reservation availability for Monday evening. Upon entering, it was low lit and purple and there were plenty of people seated and a few waiting to be seated. The indoor decorations were holiday themed and pretty and the music playlist was great; I heard a lot of songs I knew and haven't heard in awhile in a nice remix üé∂ The service was splendid, I believe our waitress was named Corin (I hope I spelled that correctly!). She was very knowledgeable of the menu, very attentive and overall pleasant ü§ó We even met one of the general managers, Edwin, whom was very polite and professional too.
Now the food! I had the surf n turf with brussel sprouts and my boyfriend had the Australian flat iron wagyu steak with mac and cheese. As for the drink, I had the Dragon cocktail, it was very sweet, right up my alley üç∏ And the appetizers consisted of the lil bite burgers and the wagyu pot stickers. Everything was splendid, from the presentation, to the flavors and the portions. Of course nothing runs cheap here, but there are some nice menus for the holidays and the $69 per person fixed menu. There's also other options like Steak Night and such. I 100% recommend this place; the lobster tail and steak had me in a chokehold...and that lobster butter?? üòãü§§ take me back üôèüèæ But yes! We look forward to going again in the future! ‚ú®

This was my first time at this wonderful establishment. Arrived with no reservations on a Friday night with my best friend and we were seated within 5 min in a very quaint area. (NYASIA) was our server and she was extremely professional, knowledgeable and pleasant! Her recommendations were ALL ON POINT!! She checked on us just enough but not overly. The delicious good arrived fast, hot and well seasoned.

It was a great experience for me and my bestie said she has never been disappointed with any of her visits there!

Thank you for an AMAZING CULINARY EXPERIENCE üíô‚ÄºÔ∏èüíØ

On November 14, 2025, at approximately 10:30 PM, I visited this location. The food was decent, especially considering the $200 price point. The atmosphere was lovely and cozy. However, the service was lacking. I had to ask multiple times just to receive water. After my meal, I ordered dessert to go and waited over 20 minutes for it. When I notified the assistant manager, he agreed to remove the dessert from my bill‚Äîbut that never happened. Due to this experience, I will not be returning to this location.

STK Steakhouse Midtown (1114 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036) has one of the best brunch deals I‚Äôve experienced. Their all-you-can-eat brunch for $39 per person is truly impressive, especially for Midtown. The space is beautiful and fully decorated for the holidays, making it perfect for a girls brunch or a date spot.

We tried one of everything, and the Chicken & Waffles were the standout perfectly crisp, tender, and full of flavor.

All You Can Eat STK Brunch Includes:
‚Ä¢	Bread Basket: Croissant, cinnamon roll, mini baguettes
‚Ä¢	Baby Gem Caesar: Parmigiano Reggiano, lemon black pepper emulsion, herb crouton
‚Ä¢	Cheese & Charcuterie: Cheddar, Manchego, prosciutto, salami, watermelon and berries
‚Ä¢	Mains: Chicken & Waffles, biscuits and gravy, cheesy tots, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage
‚Ä¢	Beverage: Coffee or orange juice

Everything was delicious, the service was great, and the holiday atmosphere made the experience even better. Highly recommend.

The spaghetti was indeed legendary- Perfect- Al dente- sauce was both mild and hearty. It might be simple but it stood out.
Peach Bellini was a beautiful + light dessert
We enjoyed the broccolini a lot.
We also tried the yellowtail, halibut, ravioli, and braised short rib. These were all good! But the above was exceptional.

Delicious pastas, key lime cheesecake was just balance and light. Only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the super rude sommelier. Our waitress suggested us to bring the sommelier to recommend a bottle of wine. Sommelier came by to our table looking very unhappy, rushing us to decide, didn‚Äôt even ask anything about what type of wine we want to drink or suggest! Only thing he said I‚Äôll let you talk and decide, I‚Äôll come back when you know!  We just decided to get a bottle of Barolo, he just said it‚Äôs a good choice then opened it for us and pour the wine in our glasses. He miss and poured some in my appetizer plate and didn‚Äôt even bother to apologize or change my plate! In the other hand the manager and our server this evening were very accommodating and helpful!
This place blew it away! The food was incredible. Delicious! from Appetizer to dessert. Highly recommend the seared scallops. Definitely A must try when you‚Äôre in NYC.

Overall, a great dining experience with one notable service caveat. My family was visiting, and we went on a Tuesday evening at 8:00 PM. Once seated, the service was excellent‚Äîbut the ma√Ætre d‚Äô experience and table timing were the main drawback.

We were unable to get a clear estimate on when our table would be ready and were asked to wait in the bar area. We ended up waiting about 45 minutes, ordering drinks at the bar that were charged separately from the table. We were finally seated around 8:45 PM, at which point Scarpetta did a nice job making it right with complimentary drinks and hors d‚Äôoeuvres. By the time we finished dinner, the restaurant was about half empty, which added to the frustration of the earlier wait.

Food-wise, everything delivered. I had the agnolotti, while others ordered the sirloin, pumpkin gnocchi, and tagliolini nero‚Äîall excellent. Desserts were also delicious, and our server was fantastic, attentive, and polished throughout the meal.

Bottom line: the food is great and well worth visiting, but better front-of-house timing communication would go a long way. We were close to leaving for another restaurant due to the uncertainty. That said, I‚Äôd absolutely return and would expect a smoother seating experience next time.

When I tell you‚Ä¶ amazing service‚Ä¶ amazing atmosphere and amazing food‚Ä¶ Scarpetta lives up the hype. I took my dad here for his birthday, and he loved it as well‚Ä¶.. I highly recommend a visit here.

Beautiful location, with excellent service, and yummy food.

The only issue I had is their prices which is why I only gave them 4 stars.  Come on now, $6 for a small cup of coffee, can't remember how much for a bottle of sparkling water, and, I think, they charged $15-$17 for a little bit of Kahlua!  The lunch food prices were more reasonable though.

Overall, tasty food, prime location, and great service!  The Boathouse was also very accommodating with us, providing us a table without a reservation! :)

Would I go again? Yes!  But I'd definitely skip the drinks next time because those drinks doubled our bill.

We had such a wonderful experience at the Central Park Boathouse on Friday, September 26! Our waiter, Jim, was extremely friendly and warm, which made the evening even more special. We ordered pasta and wine, and with the perfect weather, the windows were open so we could enjoy the fresh air and a stunning view over the lake toward Bethesda Fountain. The entire setting felt magical, like something out of a movie, showing off why New York City is such an amazing place.

The walk to and from the restaurant was just as enjoyable‚Äîpeaceful and relaxing through the park, with the bonus of stumbling upon a lively group salsa dancing event on the way home. We couldn‚Äôt resist joining in for a bit, which was the perfect ending to an already memorable night.

Highly recommend for anyone looking for a beautiful and unique New York City dining experience right inside the best park in the world!

The staff members are very friendly and professional‚Ä¶ every customer walking out very happy ‚Ä¶ the clam chowders soup Sooooooo yummy ‚Ä¶ first bite has already touched my heart! I me as the no snap no eat person just remember to take a picture when I almost done with the clam chowder soup ‚Ä¶the linguini is highlighted with huge fresh shrimps and seasoned to perfection‚Ä¶ Marc the manager very patient to address my concerns‚Ä¶

The Boathouse offered us a very pleasant dining experience. We ordered several pasta dishes and a selection of desserts; the pasta was clearly fresh and made daily, and the desserts were homemade and well executed. The food was good and enjoyable, even if not especially outstanding.

The setting is beautiful and adds a lot to the overall experience, and the service was excellent throughout the meal. The Flowers wine recommended by our waiter was a great choice. Overall, a place we would return to without hesitation.

Came here for a Bachelor Party dinner. Excellent food. Quality service. Diego made some excellent recommendations. The 3 For option is very reasonable and comes with a starter, entre, and dessert. Definitely would recommend for a date night, business meeting, or any type of celebratory dinner. Someone came for their birthday and the staff took care of them as well without obnoxious loud singing.

Right across the street from the mall. After 10pm they have live music in the basement where the bathrooms are as well. We went in. Friday night, mostly younger crowd and wait staff was very friendly.
Cole was an amazing server who was attentive and helpful with recommendations. The food was good and the atmosphere was mellow. Definitely will be going back. Thank you Cole!

This is amazing restaurant with some great drinks and food! The taqueria fight is my favorite.
Any taco or Mexican dish is great ~ I had beef cheek taco and it melts in my mouth.
highly recommended.
We went there for a quick drink and a small bite. The focaccia was so good and the sauce was really yummy!!

Such an amazing experience. The venue is designed extremely well. The food is incredible and the wait staff are very fast and very friendly!  The smash burger is life changing. Save room for cheesecake!

I absolutely loved the fish and chicken tacos! 10/10! The portions were generous and the fresh juices were a bonus. I enjoyed the flavors and would happily eat here again.
What an amazing restaurant!! Had a great dinner for 2 with Fluffy as our server! The pear and prosecco spritz was my favorite!! We had lots of left overs,  so come with the family!!
